texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I started work on packaging the  Azure CLI  and all of its components in Fedora back in July 2021 and the work finally finished just as the Fedora 35 development cycled ended. This required plenty of packaging work and I was thankful for all the advice I received along the way from experienced Fedora packagers.
texts.text: I started work on packaging the  Azure CLI  and all of its components in Fedora back in July 2021 and the work finally finished just as the Fedora 35 development cycled ended. This required plenty of packaging work and I was thankful for all the advice I received along the way from experienced Fedora packagers.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Installing Azure CLI
texts.text: Installing Azure CLI

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Make sure you're on Fedora 35 or later first. Then install
texts.text: Make sure you're on Fedora 35 or later first. Then install

texts.label: code
texts.orig: azure-cli
texts.text: azure-cli

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
$ sudo dnf -y install azure-cli
$ az --version
azure-cli                         2.29.0 *

core                              2.29.0 *
telemetry                          1.0.6

Extensions:
aks-preview                       0.5.29

Python location '/usr/bin/python3'
Extensions directory '/home/major/.azure/cliextensions'
texts.text:
$ sudo dnf -y install azure-cli
$ az --version
azure-cli                         2.29.0 *

core                              2.29.0 *
telemetry                          1.0.6

Extensions:
aks-preview                       0.5.29

Python location '/usr/bin/python3'
Extensions directory '/home/major/.azure/cliextensions'

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Authenticate with Azure
texts.text: Authenticate with Azure

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: You have two methods for authenticating with Azure:
texts.text: You have two methods for authenticating with Azure:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: via a web browser (good for desktops and workstations)
texts.text: via a web browser (good for desktops and workstations)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: via a device code (good for remote servers or virtual machines)
texts.text: via a device code (good for remote servers or virtual machines)

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: To authenticate with a browser, type
texts.text: To authenticate with a browser, type

texts.label: code
texts.orig: az login
texts.text: az login

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: and complete the steps in the browser window that appears.
texts.text: and complete the steps in the browser window that appears.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Otherwise, run
texts.text: Otherwise, run

texts.label: code
texts.orig: az login --use-device-code
texts.text: az login --use-device-code

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: and complete the steps manually using the URL and the access code provided on the command line.
texts.text: and complete the steps manually using the URL and the access code provided on the command line.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If everything works well, you should get a message saying
texts.text: If everything works well, you should get a message saying

texts.label: code
texts.orig: You have logged in.
texts.text: You have logged in.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: followed by some information about your account in JSON format.
texts.text: followed by some information about your account in JSON format.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: To the cloud!
texts.text: To the cloud!

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Most resources in Azure live inside a resource group, so let's try to create one to ensure the CLI is working and authenticated properly:
texts.text: Most resources in Azure live inside a resource group, so let's try to create one to ensure the CLI is working and authenticated properly:

texts.label: code
paragraph
texts.orig: Perfect! 🎉
texts.text: Perfect! 🎉
